warm up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to become warm, or to make someone or something warm
warm up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: With the fire on, the room should soon warm up.
Once the weather warms up, you can move the plants outdoors.
I turned on the grill to warm it up.
Come inside and have a drink. It’ll warm you up.
warm up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to heat food, especially food that has already been cooked, so that it is hot enough to eat, or to become hot enough to eat
warm up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I’ll put the lasagne in the oven to warm it up.
warm up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to do gentle physical exercises to prepare your body for dancing, sport etc
warm up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a machine or engine warms up, or if you warm it up, it becomes ready to work properly after being switched on
warm up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: He waited for the photocopier to warm up.
He started to warm up the aircraft’s engines.
warm up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: if a party, election etc warms up, it starts to become enjoyable or interesting, especially because more is happening
warm up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: The race for governor is beginning to warm up.
warm up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: if musicians, singers, or performers warm up, they practise just before a performance
warm up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: The band had little time to warm up before going on stage.
warm up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to perform or speak first at an event, so that the people listening are relaxed or excited before the main singer, speaker etc comes on
warm up.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: He warmed up the audience by telling them a few jokes.
They warmed up for U2 on one of their early tours.
warm up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a set of gentle exercises you do to prepare your body for sport, dancing etc
warm up.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a warm-up match, game, or race is held to give the sportsmen or players practice before a big event
warm up.translation[2].definitions[1].de: warm-up exercises are done to prepare your body before playing a sport or dancing
warm up.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a warm-up jacket is worn to keep you warm when you are doing exercises
warm up.translation[2].definitions[3].de: a warm-up man or band prepares the people at an event for the main speaker, singer etc by singing, telling jokes etc
